posts.post_content: This has to be the holy grail of Lands. Especially compared to all the ones that demand you align the moons of Jupiter and wash your opponents car in order to get one mana more than a basic would give anyway. This just asks you politely to toss out some things you were probably playing a lot of anyway.

posts.post_content:
If you play artifacts, and you don't play standard, invest in this. Take care of it. Tuck it in at night, give it some of your soda, take it to the movies. Buy it some nice jewelry. And it will take care of you in turn.  
  
That's what happened to me, anyway. And now the two of us have a family and a nice life together.

posts.post_content:
How is it possible this is rated lower than [Gaea's Cradle](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Gaea's Cradle)?  
The people calling this the best land ever know what's up.  
  
I mean, the Cradle is awesome, but this card is insane in any deck that caters to it even slightly.  
  
It's not hard to pump this bad boy up with Moxen, and lands like [Seat of the Synod](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Seat of the Synod) and [Darksteel Citadel](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Darksteel Citadel).  
  
Lotus + say, 2 Moxen + [Mana Vault](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mana Vault) + Academy = 11 mana round one.  
That is *true* power.  
  
If my other two cards are [Panoptic Mirror](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Panoptic Mirror) and [Time Walk](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Time Walk),  
or if I get a Demonic Tutor,   
you lose.  
  
Call it broken all you want- I'm still using this awesome blessing of a land :-D

posts.post_content: @Resyx, the reason this card is broken is because there are 0-cost artifats, and a lot of them. [Gaea's Cradle](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Gaea's Cradle) is broken because of token creatures, and the handful of 0-cost creatures that exist. There are no 0-cost enchantments, and so far only one card makes enchantment tokens, so [Serra's Sanctum](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Serra's Sanctum) is unbroken.
